description.narrative: The proposed National Solar Park Project (‘Project’) will support the national electricity utility, Electricite du Cambodge (EDC), in expanding access to clean energy and increasing solar energy generation in Cambodia. It will have two main outputs: (i) a solar park facility able to accommodate up to 100 megawatts (MW) of solar power generation on 150-200 hectares of land in selected provinces; and (ii) a 30-40-kilometer (km) 115 kilovolt (kV) transmission line connection to an existing substation (grid substation 6 or GS6). The transmission interconnection system expansion will include a solar park substation with two transformers (one additional for redundancy), switchgear, controls, and a supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) system compatible with the EDC’s SCADA requirements. It will have a new bay with switchgear at the existing GS6 substation.

activity-date.narrative: Planned start date of the activity

mailing-address.narrative: The World Bank, 1818 H Street, NW, Washington, DC 20433 USA
